suite.value: 6th Floor (Suite number appears as 'Suite 620' in Tenant post‑commencement address; Premises described as 6th floor)

lease_commencement_date.value: Commences upon (i) Landlord’s substantial completion of Tenant Improvements with City of Rogers Final Inspection; (ii) Landlord notice; (iii) Tenant has 8 business days to install FF&E after access; (iv) Tenant/agents apply for certificate of occupancy and business license.

lease_expiration_date.value: Ends on the last day of the 77th full month after the Commencement Date (Tenant may elect a 90‑month term within 14 days of Commencement).

notes.value: Base Rent begins the 1st day of the 6th full month of the Primary Term (if Tenant extends Primary Term to 90 months, Base Rent begins the 1st day of the 7th full month).
$24.50/RSF per annum; full‑service gross including OpEx, utilities, insurance and taxes; janitorial excluded.

alterations.value: Tenant may not make alterations without Landlord’s prior written consent (not unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed). Tenant may use Landlord‑approved or its own contractors (subject to approval); no LL overhead/supervision fee. All alterations must comply with laws; roof use/access expressly reserved to Landlord; Tenant may not penetrate or use roof except as provided in exhibits. Trade fixtures/shelves must be removed at end of term with restoration, ordinary wear and tear excepted.

assignment_or_sublease.value: Tenant may assign/sublet to an affiliate or successor with net worth ≥ $100,000,000. Other transfers require Landlord consent (not unreasonably withheld or delayed); consent deemed given if no response within 10 business days. If subrent exceeds Base Rent, Tenant pays 50% of excess to Landlord within 30 days of receipt. Rights/obligations assumable by subtenant with equal or greater creditworthiness, subject to Landlord approval.

events_of_default.value: Nonpayment not cured within 5 business days after Landlord’s written notice; insolvency/bankruptcy events; failure to discharge or bond mechanics’ liens within 20 days (while actively contesting in good faith holds in abeyance); other lease breaches not cured within 30 days after notice (with diligence to complete if more time needed); rejection of the lease in bankruptcy.

holdover.value: At Landlord’s option, month‑to‑month tenancy or tenancy at sufferance at 150% of the rent then payable, plus Tenant’s proportionate share of OpEx and Real Estate Taxes; additional damages if holdover exceeds 3 months, including loss from any proposed successor tenant.

coverage_details.value: Landlord: property insurance on Building at not less than replacement cost (Fire, Lightning, Extended Coverage, Vandalism & Malicious Mischief, etc.). Tenant: workers’ compensation and comprehensive general liability including personal injury and property damage—$4,000,000 per occurrence for personal injury/death and $2,000,000 for property damage; plus fire and extended coverage on replacement cost of all Tenant Improvements.

additional_insured_status.value: Tenant policies must name Landlord as additional insured; provide 30 days’ prior written notice of cancellation; expressly allow assignment of Landlord’s rights to Landlord’s mortgagee, shown as additional insured.

details.value: Tenant may terminate effective at the end of the 51st month by giving at least 6 months’ prior written notice. Landlord must provide the Termination Fee notice within 30 days of Tenant’s exercise.

paybacks.value: Tenant must reimburse Landlord within 60 days for the unamortized Tenant Improvement Allowance and broker’s commission, amortized at 7.0% per annum.

landlord_work_details.value: Standard TI Allowance: $72.22/RSF (total $1,234,239.80). If Tenant elects a 90‑month term, TI Allowance increases to $84.42/RSF (total $1,442,737.80). Allowance cannot be used for telecom/cabling/security/furniture/move costs (building capital equipment and code‑compliant signage allowed). Landlord to select licensed contractors; Core to develop CDs for $3.00/USF if Tenant provides finish drawings; GC general conditions fee $36,000 plus 6% (4% OH/2% profit); competitive bidding to at least three subcontractors per trade; Tenant may review bids. Landlord’s Work = Building core & shell per Exhibit B‑1.

tenant.value: Maintain all parts of the usable Premises in good, neat, clean, sanitary and operable condition; promptly make necessary repairs/replacements; repair damage caused by Tenant; maintain Tenant’s appliances (ice maker, refrigerator, microwave, etc.).

landlord.value: At Landlord’s expense (not as OpEx): repair/replace roof, foundation, exterior walls, interior structural walls/components, common areas, grounds, walkways, windows, and Building Systems; provide qualified maintenance personnel (Tenant pays $50/hour with 1‑hour minimum only when addressing Tenant‑responsible items).

notice_window_days.citation: Tenant must give notice not more than 365 days and not less than 180 days before expiration of the then current term. p.1–2

pass_through_details.value: Real property taxes and special assessments in excess of Base Year passed through on a prorata RSF basis; Base Year may be a later year if 2016 assessment does not reflect completed Building and Premises.

audit_rights.citation: Tenant may inspect books/records within 180 days of invoice; waiver thereafter. p.4
Tenant may examine/review Landlord’s OpEx books one time each calendar year; overstatement >5% requires reimbursement of reasonable audit cost. p.6

right_of_first_refusal.citation: Tenant has a first right of refusal on adjacent 6th floor space; 10 business days to elect; rate mirrors then‑current Lease; TI allowance prorated at 90% for remaining term per example provided. p.23

right_of_first_offer.citation: No ROFO clause found upon review of p.1–36.
